text: The Levita Stadium is a football stadium in Kfar Saba, Israel. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home stadium of Hapoel Kfar Saba and Beitar Kfar Saba. Initial plans for building this stadium were drawn in the late 1960s, and construction began in 1972. However, financial difficulties caused the construction to stop mid-way in 1973 after the Yom Kippur War. The stadium was eventually completed in 1986The Stadiums Are Coming, The Stadiums Are Coming Ma'ariv, 21 August 1986, Historical Jewish Press and is capacity of 5,800. ==References== View from Kfar Saba Park Category:Hapoel Kfar Saba F.C. title: Levita Stadium
